column5: Anòther cold day in NWO -33 In morning again.Left house around 11:30 and temp arouńd -22 and sunny.Started catching fish as soon as I was set up.Great bite and most fish today in around 20-26"pretty steady.Actually had tough time getting my 4 keepers.Few pike also with 2 good ones.reel got a workout today. What a problem to have.fished till 2 and bite was over.1/16 oz jig did the trick today.
Tried some new fish coating found in down town vermilion bay coop good stuff
Nice Fish!!! Thanks for sharing! RBF
Nice fish John, I'll have to try that breading.
Really good.bit salty so no need to add any.
Thanks, my wife likes to add salt so i'll keep that in mind!
Hopefully you dropped a bag off at Gord's for me on your way out of town . I'll be able to use it this fall... PjShorthorn
Speaking of cooking.You must not of read the post concerning a missing pot at VBL.. from Sept.lol.
That’s a haul and what a great problem to have, trying to catch enough small ones to keepFor the pan vs. hogs.

Oh, don't you worry......I saw the banter. Pot stealing in Canada must be a HUGE offense where fishing licenses are revoked for an entire fishing season, outdoors cards now are only good for 30 days instead of 3 years, housekeeping meals are closely supervised by lodge personnel during the cooking and dish washing each day, one community pot is left by the community fire pit for guests and only paper plates and plastic utensils are provided lest the fine china and cook wear ,found at flea markets, come up missing after one's visit..... Maybe you could find a new pot at the CO-OP and drop it off with my fish fry by this September. PjShorthorn
